title: Front Fork - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Raise and Support the Front of the Motorcycle
Raise and support the front of the motorcycle.

Never allow the brake calipers to hang on the brake hoses as this may damage the hoses. A damaged brake hose can cause a reduction in braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Note the routing of the ABS wheel speed sensor harness for installation.
There is a shim between the ABS wheel speed sensor and the front fork leg.
Release the fixing and detach the ABS wheel speed sensor from the left hand fork leg, and collect the shim.

body.name: Detach front speed sensor DE2 cjsm_1

body.body: Loosen the upper yoke pinch bolt.
If the forks are to be dismantled, loosen the fork top caps.
Note the orientation and position of the handlebar riser on the forks, loosen the handlebar riser pinch bolt.

body.name: Loosen upper yoke pinch bolt DE; DE2; DF; DF2; DVY (cjrj)

body.body: Loosen the lower yoke pinch bolts and slide the fork down through the yokes.

body.name: Loosen lower yoke pinch bolts DE2

body.body: Care must be taken when removing the forks, to ensure that the outer surfaces do not become scratched.
The right hand handlebar has the front brake master cylinder attached to it. Ensure the master cylinder remains upright when the handlebar riser is removed from the front fork.
As the fork is released, slide the handlebar riser off the fork and tie aside. Do not allow the handlebar to hang on the wiring harnesses or cables.
Remove the forks from the lower yoke.

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Perform the following operations:
Raise and support the front of the motorcycle.
Front Wheel - Removal
Front Mudguard - Removal

Never allow the brake calipers to hang on the brake hoses as this may damage the hoses. A damaged brake hose can cause a reduction in braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Note the routing of the ABS wheel speed sensor harness for installation.
There is a shim between the ABS wheel speed sensor and the front fork leg.
Release the fixing and detach the ABS wheel speed sensor from the left hand fork leg, and collect the shim.
Fixing
Front ABS wheel speed sensor
ABS wheel speed sensor harness
Shim
Loosen the upper yoke pinch bolt.
If the forks are to be dismantled, loosen the fork top caps.
Note the orientation and position of the handlebar riser on the forks, loosen the handlebar riser pinch bolt.
Pinch bolts
Upper yoke
Handlebar riser
Loosen the lower yoke pinch bolts and slide the fork down through the yokes.
Pinch bolts
Lower yoke
Care must be taken when removing the forks, to ensure that the outer surfaces do not become scratched.
The right hand handlebar has the front brake master cylinder attached to it. Ensure the master cylinder remains upright when the handlebar riser is removed from the front fork.
As the fork is released, slide the handlebar riser off the fork and tie aside. Do not allow the handlebar to hang on the wiring harnesses or cables.
Remove the forks from the lower yoke.
